intro: Desmanthodium ovatum, commonly known as the smoothleaf desmanthium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to orange flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are smooth and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
